David G. Ebeling, Cathy Deschenes, Jeffrey Sprague.
Center for School and Community Integration, Institute for the Study of Developmental Disabilities,
"This reference manual was produced with support from grant #HO86U00026 United States Department of Education."
Center for School and Community Integration.
Institute for the Study of Developmental Disabilities.
Energizing teacher education and professional development with problem-based learning /
Association for Supervision and Curriculum Development,
California Staff Development Council ; developed by Mary Dietz, Nanette Green, and Judy Piper.
Delta Sierra Professional Development Consortium and the California Staff Development Council,
Ethics and the early childhood educator :
Stephanie Feeney and Nancy K. Freeman.
National Association for the Education of Young Children,
National Association for the Education of Young Children.
responding to individual differences in education : linking behavioral interventions with the practitioner : middle school version.

4 program manuals (114 p. : ill. ; 28 cm.) + 1 instruction manual (61 p. ; 28 cm.) + 1 presentation master booklet ([46] p. ; 28 cm.) + 1 reproducibles packet ([30] p. ; 28 cm.) + Computer tactics bank (5 computer disks ; 3.5 in.) in container.
an inservice and preservice professional development program for classroom, remedial, and special education teachers /
v. 1. Instructor's manual -- v. 2. Participant's workbook.
Inservice and preservice professional development program for classroom, remedial, and special education teachers.
Focuses on ways to improve parking, accessible routes, entrances, and restrooms more accessible to individuals with handicaps.

Developing an individual action plan: a five-point process --
Strategies for enhancing individual Action Plans.

Each tape is packed full of tips, strategies, and specific insights from top educators, as well as scenarios and sample forms that will help successfully implement, facilitate, and document CARE (Counselor, Administrator, Resource Educator) meetings and the IAP (Individual Action Plan) process.
